entry.title: Where The Lavender Grows Wild
entry.summary:
Author: rose_quartz_queen

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 23,764Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 36

Summary: "From his vantage point on the museum steps, Buck can see Eddie for a little longer than Eddie can see him, and he watches as Eddie scans the crowd. Buck‚Äôs heart flutters in his chest, feeling like it's going to explode. He can still go home, he thinks, he can still leave. If he turns around right now, Buck can go home before Eddie even knows he was there. He can pack up his locker at work and leave, just like he did in Pennsylvania and South America. "After a not-quite-unexpected kiss, Buck and Eddie finally begin their journey as more than friends. However, as the pair get to know each other in a new way, Buck must finally come to terms with and heal from the past he has worked so hard to bury.A slow-burn fic exploring what it means to fall in love and find happiness after trauma.

entry.title: The Good I‚Äôll Do
entry.summary:
Author: ScribblesAfterDark

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,652Chapters: 8/24Kudos: 72

Summary: ‚ÄúI leave in a week,‚Äù Eddie said quietly. ‚ÄúMinimum Five-month deployment.‚ÄùThe spoon clattered against the counter, the sharp sound cutting through the air. Buck‚Äôs jaw tightened, his eyes narrowing with something too tangled to be just anger. ‚ÄúFive months? You were supposed to be done in three. No more deployments‚Ä¶We were supposed to finally settle down. Put down some roots. Be on the same fucking continent for more than a few months at a time.‚ÄùOr, They survived deployments and the kind of chaos only Buck could attract. Falling in love should‚Äôve been the easy part. Now married and raising Christopher, they‚Äôve finally built the family they once only dreamed about‚Ä¶except Eddie‚Äôs been deployed again, and long-distance is proving tougher than any mission.

entry.title: Dalmatians and Daddies
entry.summary:
Author: ThistleFirethorn

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,523Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 173

Summary: Age Regression Au!Eddie loves Buck. He loves everything about him. He loves all of his neurotic annoying little habits. He loves his earnest naivety. He even loves how Buck can simultaneously be the most selfish and selfless person at the same time.Eddie knows that Buck loves him too. Loves him with every ounce of that loyalty and care he has for the important people in his life.There is just one problem....Buck's age regression.Don't misunderstand. Eddie loves that part of Buck too. He loves little Evan. Evan is the most adorable and vulnerable parts of Buck. It is beautiful to be part of that experience.The problem is, Eddie isn't the one little Evan wants.Little Evan wants Bobby.~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~Or: Eddie and Buck are in a romantic relationship...but...Bobby is Evan's primary littlespace caregiver (Nonsexual. Obviously.)

entry.title: Game Set Match Love Across the Net
entry.summary:
Author: BathenaHearts118

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,608Chapters: 3/20Kudos: 1

Summary: ---Game. Set. Match: Love Across the Net¬†---SummaryGame. Set. Match: Love Across the Net follows the intertwined lives of tennis champions and their families, exploring rivalry, desire, and legacy on and off the court. Bobby Nash and Athena Carter, former Australian singles champions, face old rivals Brad Torrance and Marcy James. Initial rivalries escalate when injuries force doubles partnerships, forcing players into emotional proximity, and igniting passion, jealousy, and unresolved desire.¬†As the tournament progresses from singles to doubles, semi-finals to finals, tensions rise: unspoken attraction, family legacy, and generational rivalries intertwine. By the tournament‚Äôs climax, confessions, romance, and competitive intensity merge into an unforgettable finale, leaving the next generation poised to continue both the rivalries and the romances.¬†---

entry.title: What Died Didn't Stay Dead (Your Alive Your Alive)
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,835Chapters: 5/12Kudos: 121

Summary: ‚ÄúI am looking for the Captain of this firehouse,‚Äù he heard the voice say. Hen and Chimney, who he knew were nosy, were already up and leaning over the loft‚Äôs balcony. ‚Ä®‚Ä®He heard Tommy say, ‚ÄúOh, you must be the person replacing me. Let me get Captain Nash for you.‚Äù He was friendly, but Bobby could hear a hint of mockery in that response.‚ÄúYou said Captain Nash?‚Äù the voice said, and without a doubt Bobby knew by the way he said his last name who was standing down in that bay and wasn‚Äôt going to be sticking around. He dropped the spoon he was stirring with, and it crashed to the ground as he bolted from around the counter towards the edge of the loft.‚ÄúBuck,‚Äù he yelled, and the man with his back towards him kept walking. He started to take the stairs, and the figure kept walking, ‚ÄúBuck.‚Äù He could hear Hen and Chimeny following and saying, ‚ÄúWho is Buck?‚Äù but he didn‚Äôt have time to explain. He said the kid‚Äôs name several more times as he reached the bottom of the stairs.And when the figure was almost out of the firehouse doors, Bobby finally used his fatherly voice and yelled, ‚ÄúEVAN JAMES BUCKLEY YOU BETTER TURN YOUR ASS AROUND RIGHT NOW.‚Äù The figure stopped moving, but he did not turn around.

entry.title: Beneath the Same Broken Sky
entry.summary:
Author: Buki_stories21

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 207,826Chapters: 30/?Kudos: 934

Summary: He stopped in front of her, like he didn't know what to say. Fiona just stared at him. Lip stirred beside her."You got a baby," he said."Two," she replied, chin jerking toward Lip.He blinked. Then, slowly, he dropped his bag and unzipped it. He pulled out a sandwich, squished, half-eaten, wrapped in a crumpled napkin, and held it out to her."You can have the rest," he said. "It's peanut butter. No jelly."Fiona hesitated. Her stomach twisted with hunger, but she'd been taught not to trust strangers, even if they were small and sad-looking like her. Still... a sandwich was a sandwich.She reached out and took it."Thanks."He sat down next to her on the curb without asking. Just dropped his backpack by his feet and let out a sigh like someone twice his age."I'm Evan," he said, picking at the edge of his sneaker sole."Fiona."
